Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/instructioncost-h/#l00173">173</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/instructioncost-h">InstructionCost.h</a>.

### operator+=() {#a79829a95fb4e733a459c2d65ced4a293}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>InstructionCost &amp; llvm::InstructionCost::operator+= (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instructioncost">InstructionCost</a> &amp; RHS)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
For all of the arithmetic operators provided here any invalid state is perpetuated and cannot be removed.

Once a cost becomes invalid it stays invalid, and it also inherits any invalid state from the RHS. Arithmetic work on the actual values is implemented with saturation, to avoid overflow when using more extreme cost values.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/instructioncost-h/#l00099">99</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/instructioncost-h">InstructionCost.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### operator+=() {#a0eb2c1aeae46e9c414e94547740e1025}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>InstructionCost &amp; llvm::InstructionCost::operator+= (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="#a5dbf65370a0656ea05a0aa97380c15cc">CostType</a> RHS)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/instructioncost-h/#l00111">111</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/instructioncost-h">InstructionCost.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### operator&lt;() {#aa0e99b0b79a9c06dc6dd0547a4f83cea}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::InstructionCost::operator&lt; (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instructioncost">InstructionCost</a> &amp; RHS) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
For the comparison operators we have chosen to use lexicographical ordering where valid costs are always considered to be less than invalid costs.

This avoids having to add asserts to the comparison operators that the states are valid and users can test for validity of the cost explicitly.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/instructioncost-h/#l00195">195</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/instructioncost-h">InstructionCost.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
